title: 茧
content:
家庭，学校，国家
教了我纪律
做爱，顺从
礼仪，感恩
我只学会了躲进皮里
没人能告诉我是谁
没人能教我死亡
我在学习
看割断的人头
枪毙的视频
吊死的遗体
腐烂的尸体
死亡
无孔不入的抽象概念
我摆弄着我吐出的蚕丝
把餐盒的骨头
还有我拙劣的自制甜点
统统倒进垃圾筒里
这些天我把自己网住
一动不动，祈祷着永眠
人们也会抢着把茧煮净
没人想容忍
蛾子用仅剩的几天
来回扑在灯泡上

和异性性交的女性

我是0%

男性吊死后
会有勃起
这是交媾的邀请

把我顶撞得
眼珠凸起
我的生活
我的性器官都长了层茧
任凭春天的复苏
夏天的酷热
秋天的萧瑟
冬天的饥饿
都刮不下来
如果死亡再次插入
像终于搂住爱人
我想我会愉悦尖叫
也许会腿软得三天下不了床
腿骨弯曲，再也闭不拢腿
我的血管再次轰鸣
屎尿横流
这依旧是我的身体
任凭人们怎么羞辱，占有
它比活态更是0
我触摸9岁的记忆
生锈的钢床
满是灰尘的棉花软被
我从没触碰过丝绸被的富裕
无数亲人死在床上
转盘这次指向了我
他们给我穿上松香的气味
我会总结我的生命
它是礼物
无法撤回
我会理好寿衣
人人都会说

不同于爱人
我们双方不追求高潮
随时都能中止
如同
砸向头的石瓦
刺耳的刹车声
拐卖金属的闷击

title: 老鼠
content:
我曾把6年的身体给了母亲
换取成为自己的自由
但他不是母亲
他的言论和精子一样乱撒
变成药，药死了自己
也药死了部分的我
23年的边界给了家庭，
思想给了国家，
换取食物和住所
温情对我如同
锃亮的刀对
后院的母猪
3年的爱给了黑狗
换取爱和安全
在他快被药死的日子
8天不吃不喝
舔我的手
止泻药让他起死回生
刚洗完澡又跑去稻草里打滚
好得让人害怕他的衰老
趴在楼下睡觉的某天
他带着爱一起失踪了
接下来的几十年
我要用体力换存在的资格
逃离海和直升机
攀爬成为公民的围墙
骨头在路上不会少见
墙会越来越高
骨头，墙里可能会有更多
我用十四年的逃跑
兜取满溢的疲惫
我的后腿发达得不同寻常
我在草地躺下
告诉秃鹫我准备好了
现在我想把50年的未知
支付给你，死亡
不支付给鹰爪
不支付给强奸者
不支付给屠夫
不支付给纳粹
我这一生大概很可怕
除了生命没有其他货币
在我终结那天
同行的老鼠可能会围作一团
说：“我认识那只老鼠。
前几天她还好好的
为什么不继续了？”
不久它们会散开
回去啃食自己的虫子
或许还会到巴黎
去做蔬菜杂烩呢

title: 墙纸
content:
穴居洞穴
烤肉
在鹿骨头旁
生存，一切都是为了生存
饥饿的手
抢走我的脊椎
我已没有半点肉
家人们用石头
砸碎腿骨
吮吸我的脑髓
你们是生存者
我从来不是
有人飞去瑞士
买来昂贵平静的死亡
一些人会和这里的孩子一样
死在公共厕所里
这些日子我看不到光
铝制的火化舱在召唤我
工厂太过高效
他们连着我的尸体和死因
统统塞进去
粪便和骨灰，砖灰
全部混在一起
希望这种混合物
不会毒死植物
骡子们依旧高喊喇叭
关于政治，人种，难民
阶级，女人，孩子
有很多道理
人们把火球扔向彼此
骡子从来西装整洁
从没焦边
一些教师
教男孩血性
播放希特勒的伟岸
一些教师
站在石头上教孩子
去记住失去的人
是什么让先知成为先知
洞穴墙
石头墙
木墙
压花墙
白墙
墙不断变化
人从未变化
自几万年前我们便做同样的事
推倒柏林墙
推倒长城
必然压死一部分人
然后呢？
会是新未来吗？

title: 葬礼2
content:
在我的葬礼后
梳梳头发，
让生活变得健康柔顺
看看时钟
尽量换上舒适的衣服
我不是个好学生
我也不热爱生活
但后来的人
希望我是个好的教例
我没道别
我没有爱人
但今天请把孩子和小狗放在一起
让欢笑和尾巴一起拍打
父母们
放下肩膀吧
你和孩子都是树
不是木材
这是片神圣的树林
没人能锯走
我还有这躯体时
看不到曙光
自由，我从未见过。
希望世界可以采取它
我脱离人际
我不信耶稣
人们
请跨过沟壑

title: 葬礼1
content:
在我的葬礼
你也会想
死亡是个事件
和我无关
看见我的尸体
曾经自主活动的东西
如今变成了器具
不出几小时就会发臭
你还是会想
下餐吃什么或是
要出去透气
我们逃避着时间
但各种疾病也会咬住我们
我们怕虫
但这是虫的世界
疼痛不止于
在我身上乱钻的蛆虫
还在每个人的可能里
累积的病因里
虫卵里
子宫里。
我们建造堤坝
为活命抵抗，
守护– 管它是什么
老人孩子，金钱尊严
玻璃制的东西。
我们奔跑一辈子
逃离死亡，疾病
追逐眼前的金光
确实能让人前进
直到快跑不动了
于是一些人繁殖
抛下自己的种子
延续的渴望死去
沉痛再次袭来–
我们为自己而活
为自己而哭
栽培的未来凋零
细菌侵蚀肉身
我们最终各自溺亡。

title: 某天下午的树林
content:
某天下午的树林
阳光明媚
我的遗体宣告着我的选择
同一件事情上
低位者的总是错的。
一些人把生命放在未来
一些人放在正确上
一些人放在爱
一些人放在自由上
人人做梦
住在厚厚的沙堡里
我错了一辈子
但正确从不吸引我
同样，存活也从不吸引我。
我把生命织成寿衣
裹成礼物献给你
甜蜜的宣誓：“我离去了”
刺痛。空气弥漫着
蓝环章鱼的毒素
生存威胁我的
成熟或必然的
我早抛在脑后
把正确外覆
有累积的代价
蛹困不住飞蛾–
这是你几十年的希望和努力

title: 蝇王The lord of flies
content:
The teacher once said —
nowadays, things are advanced:
even pigs die painlessly,
electrocuted,
without knowing,
without struggle.
Ignorance, and brevity — how enviable.
My poverty is embarrassing.
Living, I’m less than human;
dying, I’m less than a pig.
All I have is a rope.
My legs would flee the rigor of death,
for freedom always comes with a price.
Winter. The wasteland.
I search for roots,
chew on soil —
hunger always drives one to choose.
They say the rope is painless too,
but “painless” was never true.
Death is an entrance ticket,
and every show requires a fee.
Again, I knocked on my family’s door.
Of course, they would embrace me,
rejoicing at my return:
first, because the time was right,
and second, because in hunger and cold
I learned loyalty.
Diligence overflows with happiness.
They stuffed my shredded flesh
into my own intestines,
hung the work high,
where wind and salt conspire—
before rot settles home,
they trample out the water,
let fat blend with muscle.
I sway,
brewing the sweetness of the New Year.
My head, too, hangs on an iron hook,
watching both life and its end—
speechless now,
without island or flies,
eternally smiling:
the mask of a pig’s head.
When New Year guests arrive,
I’ll be sliced and steamed,
no salt needed—perhaps an egg for garnish.
I shall release, from over twenty years,
my natural savor.
Everyone will lick their lips,
pat their bellies,
and praise this rebellious delicacy.

title: houseless
content:
I wouldn’t call myself homeless—
at least I can still look at it
every day.
I’m still stranded on the beach,
living off trash and dead fish.
Someday, I’ll grow wings
and fly toward the line
where heaven meets the earth.
I once curled inside a tent of art,
and called it home.
That’s what the living call virtue—
Death is not a solution,
You must find hope.
What is hope?
Hunger won’t blow my tent away,
wear won’t drip through its roof,
no knife slits its door at night,
no one drives me out anymore.
Erasure is never that simple.
They wiped out
one fourth of the Jews—
harder, perhaps,
than cleansing themselves.
This illness has followed me
for over ten years.
Soup won’t cure it,
a tent won’t cure it.
I think I inherited
a landlord’s greed,
and still can’t feel
the beauty of being alive.
I have limbs. I am still breathing.
Yet I keep gazing at the far shore—
and in the wind
echoes the bitterness
of From the New World.

至少我能天天望着它
我依然困在沙滩上
以垃圾和死鱼为生。
终有一天我会长出翅膀
飞去天与地的交界线
我曾蜷缩在艺术的帐篷里
把它称为家
这是现世人们所称赞的–
死亡不是解决问题
要找到希望。
希望是什么？
饥饿不会吹翻我的帐篷
磨损不会滴穿篷顶
没刀深夜割门
没人再把我驱赶
消灭不止那么简单
他们清除了
1/4 的犹太人
比清理他们自己要
困难得多
这是我十多年的痼疾
汤不能解决
帐篷不能解决
我想我继承了地主的贪婪
依旧感受不到存活之美
我有四肢，我还活着。

风中响起

title: 蝇王
content:
老师曾说现在先进了
猪也会被电击
无痛死去
无知和短促令人渴望
我的贫瘠让人尴尬

我只有绳子
腿会逃离尸僵

我学会了忠诚

灌进我的肠衣

乘着腐烂安家前
踩踏出水分
脂肪融入肌肉
我摇摆着
酝酿新年的甜蜜。

注视着生命和结局—
失去了语言、小岛和苍蝇
永恒微笑的
猪头面具
新年宾客们都会到场

无需放盐，加蛋点缀

天然的鲜美。

title: 磷灰石phosphate
content:
People’s lives begin
at the crater,
on a forty-five-degree slope.
Most slide downward backward.
Production always manages
to deliver children
to the top of the slope.
I have slipped one-fifth of the way.
My parents grasp my long hair
to slow their own aging fatigue.
One day their legs cramp,
and they tumble faster.
They clutch the insurance—
more fragile than straw,
tied to soil and roots—
they slide into the volcano,
screaming, merging violently with the lava.
If life only begins
after witnessing another’s death,
I have seen it.
Yet life says:
“It’s your turn.”
For a time,
I am shrouded in pain,
my body reaching toward that patch of scalp,
as I long for the wings of a bird.
The pain subsides.
From the beginning to now,
how much phosphate will crystallize
from this surging terminus?
People never return,
just as that patch of scalp
will never grow hair again.
Your anger is too enduring,
born from the core of the earth.
Billions of years of bones
cannot fill the vent holes of your epidermis.
Your cause is not biological—
lice merely shake themselves off.
It is something deeper,
a geologic, elemental reason,
an eternal fury
that can only destroy itself.
Bright yellow peels back the dark-gray shell,
the surging flare—
will it erupt like Pompeii?
This is no hell;
this is an orchard of destruction,
with humid air,
birds and the deep green of rainforest.
The wind brushes my scalp,
a cool tickling.
As I slide down,
I lose more,
and gain certain things,
until the end.
I think I have begun to live.

title: 哭泣The cry
content:
If it happens often enough,
we learn.
To a child,
early education is not a toy.
The brain and the skull, soft alike,
mold easier than clay.
I am tied to a tree,
indolent as a lady of leisure.
Six handkerchiefs are my price.
They call you a saint—
spotless suit,
clean-shaven chin,
your silence roaring of human superiority.
You draw swiftly, elegantly,
as they pierce my chest again.
The earth is rich, yet food is scarce.
Man and livestock differ little—
for meat, for sex, for labor.
If possible, perhaps,
I am a lipstick-wearing ape,
a sheep upon the deck,
the chosen queen bee,
a cow of perpetual milk.
I watch my kin
hack off my limbs,
each holding a precious handkerchief,
roasting a piece of my flesh.
If I still had feet,
I would curl my toes—
lived so long,
yet gained not the fat of a pig.
Some handkerchiefs are beer.
People give birth,
then sell their daughters.
Each birth
arrives with vast pain.
When pain spreads worldwide,
it becomes ordinary,
like weeds.
In Rome, I wear a metal collar.
On plantations, my body is scarred.
The Gulag’s uniform,
the camp’s tattooed number.
I cannot press myself out the fence of family love,
nor squeeze into the anti-migrant walls.
I cannot escape parasites or hunger.
So I go on,
drinking hormones in the slaughterhouse.
Death spares no one,
not even you.
Before your last breath,
you stare at the ceiling,
shouting: “The horror! The horror!”
I think infants see that thing too—
that’s why,
the moment they arrive,
they wail.

title: 哭泣
content:
如果它发生得频繁
人就会学习
在孩子眼里
早教不只是玩具
大脑和脑壳般柔软
比陶土更易塑形
我被绑在树上
贵妇般懒散
6 块手帕是我的价钱
他们称你为圣人
一尘不染的西装
干净的下巴
沉默高呼着人的优越.
你飞快又雅致地画着草图
当他们再次刺穿我的胸膛
地球丰饶, 却总缺食物
人和牲畜的差别不大
肉用，性用，劳用。
如果，可能。
我是涂口红, 穿胸罩的猩猩
甲板上的绵羊,
是被选中的蜂后。
常年产奶的奶牛。
我看着族人
砍下我的四肢
各自拿着珍贵的手帕
烤着我的肉块
如果我还有双脚
我会蜷起脚趾
白活了那么久
却没有猪的脂肪
一些手帕是啤酒
人们生下孩子
卖掉她们.
每次出生
都伴随巨大的痛苦
当痛苦遍布全球
它就理所当然
如同野草
在罗马, 我带着金属项圈
在种植园, 我满身疤痕。
古拉格里的制服,
集中营里的编号,
挤不出家庭爱的围栏
挤不进防移民的高墙
逃不过寄生虫和饥饿
于是我继续
在屠宰场里喝着激素
死亡不会饶过任何人
包括你.
在咽气前
你望着天花板
大喊: “The horror! The horror!”
我想婴儿也看到了那东西–
这就是为什么生下来
会哇哇大哭。

人和牲畜的差别并不大

甲板上的绵羊

我为自己活了那么久

一些手帕是啤酒
人们生下女儿

数量堆积变得一文不值

title: 磷灰石
content:
人们的生活起始于
火山口
45度的斜坡
多数人是倒着滑落的。
生产总能把孩子们
送到斜坡顶端。
我已滑落了1/5的距离
父母抓住我的长发
避免自己老去的脱力
某天他们腿部抽筋
加速滑落了下去
他们抓住了保险
它比稻草更脆弱
连着土壤和根须
他们滑进了火山
尖叫猛的融进了岩浆。
如果说只有见证别人死亡
我们才会开始生活
我见证了
但生活却说：
“轮到你了”
某段时间我被
痛感笼罩
身体伸向那块头皮
正如我渴求鸟的翅膀
疼痛缓息
从开始到现在
这翻涌的终点
会结晶出多少磷灰石？
人们不再回来
正如我那块头皮也
永远长不出头发
你怒火过于持久
它源于地核
几亿年的骨头
都填不满你表皮的发泄孔
你的原因不是生物
虱子只用甩甩。
是某种更深的东西
地核般本质的原因
只能砸毁自己的
永生的愤怒
明黄掀开黑灰的表壳
翻涌的耀斑
会是庞贝式的喷发吗？
这里不同于地狱
这是摧毁的果园
有潮湿空气
飞鸟和热带雨林的深绿
风拂过头皮
凉爽的痒意
在滑落过程中
我会失去更多东西
同时获得某些东西
直到终点。
我想我开始生活了。

title: 痕迹Trace
content:
I leave no trace of paper.
The white beam of inspection comes unannounced.
Children swallow crumpled notes,
the breath of punishment choking in their throats.
Humans, too, have left their marks on earth—
calloused skin scraping stone,
blood rinsed away,
bones left to dry.
Erased lives
still carved in memory,
burning, stinging.
I never heard the trumpet.
They had already charged ahead—
students, workers, the old.
They once existed,
pulled the pin on their own lives.
Terror belongs only to the beginning,
a few peals before the storm.
Afterward, thunder grows frequent,
as pale as rain.
The cat crushed by the roadside—
its only difference from man
is how quickly the body is cleared away.
What lets one cross death?
The battalion marching toward light—
is the fall from the cliff
nothing but wasted weightlessness?
Like a moth diving into flame,
some summons outweighs life itself.
Perhaps that’s why our existence
extends beyond the film’s opening scene—
the maid scrubbing
a dog’s excrement.
My first twenty years—
a child in the corner, sucking fingers,
rocking back and forth.
I still do not love life,
nor understand its meaning.
But if this rising
is merely a final flare,
if I have only days left,
I can still, at least,
set a few cups and plates straight.

content:
如果传统包含凌迟

敲打温情的钉子，
穿过骨头和神经
这个十字架
登记过每位成员。
凌迟。
一片片，
鱼腮一样呼吸
回环。
蛇吃下自己的尾巴
反呕，粘液
蟒蛇弹性的下巴
冷却的脂肪，碎肉
眼球，指甲
养大我的是呕吐的营养
生命如衣物
年轻有选择时
我们会把它挂在椅子上。
如果撞在死路前
我也会举起双手吗？
像周围气球的残骸？
黑暗，高光手电筒。水泥墙
人体百分之八十是水
瞬间的爆裂是幸运的
很多是缓慢的
癌细胞般增殖
像是事后清刷墙壁的孩子

title: 雷迪的铜塔Lady’s Copper Tower
content:
Before their daughters turn eighteen,
people guard their chastity
like pearls.
They lock them in copper towers,
click —
the sound of assurance,
the most solid guarantee.
But people forget the cracks.
Flies slip in.
I often think I am a living corpse,
fragrant since the age of nine.
They are not kitchen gentlemen,
not ones who heed a waving hand.
They come from tropical savannas,
they burrow through skin,
their thirst for blood outlives death.
Your art gives birth upon my body—
white, tadpole-like lives.
“This is nourishment, this is seed.
Pure pleasure. Golden rain.”
you said.
Is all art erotic?
It used to be paintings, now it is the lens.
Artists fix their focus on the receiver,
erection, convulsion,
Insects mating,
surging tides.
the splendor of legs flung open.
I am not a good actress.
Directors smash their cameras in rage—
I never give any reaction.
So they unite,
needles probing my spinal cord,
yet my legs only kick—
mechanical, lifeless, reflexive.
The mistake lies
in expecting a response from still life.
Living beings are supple;
still things hold other worth.
Your seeds in my flesh hatch into little flies—
a perfect harmony of mission and act:
one flies, one breeds.
The biological golden ratio.
You call it golden rain?
I call it urine.
And my father’s fear included—
the one locked in the copper house
was never me.
Of course he’ll be overthrown,
but not by you,
nor by my little flies,
nor by the Furies of revenge—
by himself.

title: 雷迪的铜塔
content:
人们在女儿18岁前
捍卫她的贞洁
如同珍珠。
会把她们锁进铜塔里
咔哒一声
这是最踏实的保证。
但是人们忘了缝隙
苍蝇时常飞入。
我常想我是活尸
9岁起就散发着芳香
它们不是厨房的绅士
能反应挥手的信号
它们来自热带草原
会钻进皮肤
对血的渴望超越死亡。
你们的艺术在我身上诞下–
白色蝌蚪般的生命。
“这是营养，这是种子。
纯粹的愉悦。金雨。”
你们说。
所有的艺术都是色情的？
以前是画，现在是镜头。
艺术家们把焦点对准受体
勃起，抽搐。
昆虫交尾
升腾的浪潮。
弹飞双腿的美妙。
我不是好演员
导演们砸烂相机怒骂–
我从不给任何反应
所以人们常常团结
针戳我的脊髓
但我腿部只是蹬出–
没劲的机械结构。
错误在于:
对静物抱有期待。
生物是灵活的
静物还有其他价值
你们的种子在我肉里变成了小苍蝇
使命和行为
让人大拍手掌的契合–
一个飞翔，一个孕育。
生物版本的黄金比率–
你管这叫金雨？
我称它是尿液。
包括我父亲的恐惧–
被锁在铜屋的从不是我。
他当然会被推翻
但不是被你们
也不是被我的小苍蝇们
不是复仇三女神
是他自己

title: 瘙痒
content:
一开始的想法:
一个人背后总是瘙痒疼痛. 但总是看不出有什么变化, 会拿东西发泄
周围人看到了, 一些人以为这个人小题大做, 或是觉得得去看医生
祂走遍这个世界, 寻找医生, 但是都只开了药, 而不救助.
祂常常问存在的意义, 上帝, 哲学. 但好像都找不到根基, 艺术作品也越来越缓解不了祂的疼痛了.
快死的那些日子里, 祂还和别人一起坐着, 祂听着那些人唧唧喳喳的永远谈钱, 谈生存谈孩子. 但是 mind 早就远离这个世界了.
最后祂 blown her head out.
在桥的一角, 流浪汉常常来, 看到祂的尸体就不常来了. 也许祂会后悔夺走了流浪汉的家, 但祂还能死在哪呢?
祂的背又开始瘙痒
可能几年前就有
祂总是把皮肤挠得红肿.
想把皮底下的东西毁灭.
“忍忍就好了”
一些人说.
一些人同情的看祂
说"去看看医生吧."
祂走遍了沙漠和湖泊
医生看不出皮肤下有什么病症
他们开了止痛药,
摆摆手, 说下一个
像是给乞丐的打发
在旅馆的某些日子
祂也跪下乞求上帝,
求助哲学,
像是隔着窗户看别人家的团圆
祂只感到空乏饥饿.
甲虫静静爬过墙壁.
当疼痛难耐,
祂决定把痛苦摊在纸上
每页的血渍的弧度像图腾
阿拉伯书法般优雅.
一些人很大方
用干净的纸的价钱买祂的作品
这是他们困在厕所的救命稻草.
海草摇摆在海浪中,
某种冲不走的东西是什么?
瘙痒? 还是自己?
祂看着明媚到像幻觉的海岸
祂错待了很多东西
自己的椅子, 车子,
桌子, 背包
它们因自己的疼痛破碎
祂擅长的是摧毁
不是金缮
祂同时擅长赠礼
祂珍爱的, 日常的东西
都提前送给了虫.
在咖啡馆, 祂坐着呆望向窗外
也许祂早不自觉的坐上了光速列车
时间并不约束于祂.
同样, 那些大声谈论的人也打断不了祂
无论走到哪里, 人们都在叫嚷着钱, 孩子.
瘙痒绕着脊柱形成菌丝体
慢慢形成了跳动的疼痛
跳动, 心脏
一个生命寄生在身上
还是祂寄生在这个生命上?
某种程度上祂像是雨后的蘑菇.
祂最后的作品在桥洞下
这次血迹不是在纸上, 是在墙上.
是一副用墨豪迈的中国草书.
来路不明的枪是祂的毛笔.
流浪汉受到惊吓,
然后拿走了自己的被褥.
如果祂还有只眼睛能动,
也许祂可能会放过这个流浪汉
找其他地方腐烂, 而不是祂的家.
但也正如流浪汉搬家一样
城市是人的, 绿地是虫的.
祂还能去哪呢?

title: Slide
content:
I slid into this place,
Up and down.
a buoy forgotten in the sea.
When I am drowning, I am a swan.
When I am up. I am numb as a log.
I am the man in the village
who was blown in half.
He slides to the worm’s side
Barely a man.
I am a strong and lucky person
The bomb didn’t destroyed my beating heart
Pink orange, misty town
black blue water.
Gravity. anchor.
Tell me it will be alright?
I won’t believe you.
Tell me that’s living?

headsman, I run to you
You are soft like mom
Like my dog’s fur

headsman, If you want, I will.

title: 蜂群
蜂群
baby
content:
Baby is holy, baby is loving.
A mother is tormented
when asked why she brought them here.
You are the child of cousins.
I am my mother’s child.
You and I may have a child.
Child is sperm left in a vagina.
Giving Child is female’s job
They swell like queen ant, delivering miracles,
Miracles can be queens, sperms, workers, or honey barrels.
They pick teeth with toothpicks
Says pain is Inevitable.
In funeral parties, family meetings, car seats
villagers asked me to marry in my twenties,
because their sons are tall and rich.
They taught the next generation to multiply like me,
to give birth until the house turns into a kindergarten.
Women get married in gray garages,
old people bless in silence,
and cooks bring naked Barbies
under meat covers for celebration.
At school, a girl said she was pregnant.
Her boyfriend was to marry within days.
A teacher yelled: “Why don’t you give birth now?”
My mother had a stillborn in her forties.
Experts convince women to obey—
Have more children.
child gives birth to child—
In the battlefield, Molotov in hand.
I said I may abuse the child,
because oxygen is running out.
A friend’s mother wished to die,
and first to hang her child.
Baby stands before my hanging.
I dream of my dog—he limps to comfort me,
tail wagging; I twist his neck.
Baby is what they cannot bear,
because of forced sterilization.
Child of mother. Child of family
Child of race, Child of nation
Child of Hitler, Child of Stalin.
Child of peace, Child of war.
We are not solid.
Every century, flushed away.
Our existence:
a child never in my womb.

content:
I got this ticket as a present on my eighteenth birthday.
It came from my mother, unintentionally.
She didn’t realize—
relieving pain was far more important.
It was booze to an alcoholic.
I vomited. It was too much.
Even after I was clean
I still long for it,
like the sky to a bird.
I was amused in strange days.
The ticket is my shield.
Ten thousand may fall at my side,
but never on me.
I am the bitch who takes hours in a bubble bath
while you and the others wait outside the door,
waiting to confront me with my damages—
drinking, sex, money problems.
My homeless story can’t buy your patience now.
I shave my legs.
You pound the door.
I walk outside in my bathrobe,
elegant as a Nazi officer’s coat.
You have called a doctor for my trial,
but outfits can’t fool me.
I walk out that door:
cemetery, Elysian field.
I always depend on the kindness of the ticket.

title: Dragon Chariot
content:
Some called you mad,
some said dreadfully brave.
You wrapped my shroud in gold—
my mother, half-god.
Father wept,
a heroic man,
howling for what cannot return.
Your rage and love tear a hole in me,
my mother, my murderer.
I was born with a leash.
First, his.
Now, yours.
The divorce papers never asked me.
He wanted a boy—
and I am not.
Life knows no mercy.
I seek the quick of mercy.
Life can be a slow poison.
The man unveils his kindness,
flings coins and curses at our faces.
Clever, he thrives.
I am the easy one.
But what’s the point?
I blaze like the sun.
I am far beyond this world.

title: Village girl
content:
You can’t call me a fallen woman
I have never been pure–since I was nine.
I’m no widow,
no milk souring on a shelf.
I still want no man, and no man wants me.
Caged lesbians still pick men.
The wind is not from the sea—
it rises in the walls,
dry, dusty,
peeling skin, layer by layer.
There is always a bomb in the family.
Everyone moves with caution.
I make love with my rapist—
for freedom, for defense,
for cure, for waste,
for centuries of waste.
There is always a price.
Again, the village bomb goes off.
the price falls on them, never on me.
Time ticks—
seize joy, seize what matters?
Perhaps I’ll never learn.

title: Wilderness Lesson
content:
Hunger taught me no lesson,
nor did the dog’s death.
Rain has extinguished the flames
leaving my city walls decadent
with charcoal.
I wandered the wilderness;
I can still see the world without my eyes.
That dog who saved me from the cliff
was gone.
Soon you replaced him with
another dog as a gift.
He was still unweaned,
and drifted away within days.
Now you set a feast at the door
and call me home–
Because that’s what families do.
Such offsets do me no good.
Is there another Troy for you to burn?

title: fear
content:
I said I do not fear death,
as poets and philosophers said,
while storms approach.
Yet fear waits
when you finally meet it—
when pain and the void arrive.
All knowledge fails.
Under rolling thunder,
we are lost as infants.
Fear is what they used
in the camp:
electric stun, handcuffs, tiger chair.
Boots on our faces,
they kick us back into our bodies,
along with truth and our reaching tentacles.
Our souls shrink like snails.
Insecticide cannot destroy us,
nor sterilization.
There will be
rage, injustice,
turning us into a red dragon.
We tear most of ourselves down—
and become infants again.
The future—
will it be without fear?

title: come back where you belong
content:
[[绝望-不可逆, 脆弱感]],[[内省]],[[多情绪杂糅]]
You want to be free
as I once did.
You cried;
Life has left you nothing but bruises.
You showed me your wings,
Transparent, fragile—
a baby bird
trembling with urgent longing.
“Don’t do it.”
That’s what they told me.
I didn’t understand then;
I still don’t.
What’s done is done.
I followed that light for closure.
Those who choose to fly
often find a deep hole waiting.
Maybe you’ll understand one day.
For now, wipe your tears;
Touch sweetness to your tongue;
Come back where you belong.

title: hooker
content:
她猛的醒了过来, 现在快到10点, 她要收拾衣服尽快回到学校. 她拿走了桌子上皱皱的500块钱. 一个多月的饭钱到手. 大学生应该赚得更多, 下次该要多点, 回去的路上她暗暗盘算.
第二天手机上又有下一个男人. 一旦你开始了, 无论是人脉还是金钱都像树根一样蔓延, 慢慢的侵入整个脑子. 她坐着男人的车边开边想. 她还没来过一场车震, 这会是不错的感觉, 路过的人们会用看动物交配的眼神看我们. 鄙视. 一种本真坦荡的感觉. 那些四五十岁的老男人总是喜欢吮吸年轻的身体, 她也能感受自己的生命在被吸走. 每次连接, 冲撞, 新老白鼠的血液循环被缝合在一起的感觉. 她有些喜欢分享自己的生命, 他喝下她就像喝下耶稣的血. 喝多了, 便把酒吐满床单. 她看着床单上的生命, 像是便利店几十块的劣质红酒. 她默默擦去呕吐物. 完事后, 他沉沉睡去. 她好奇的看着他的脸, 等待他脸上的皱纹消失.
在廉价酒馆的床上, 她看着这个男人睡着了, 满是毛发的大肚子, 头发斑白. 房间里的空气很舒服, 潮湿的温暖. 充满了爱的气息, 精液的气息. 这个年龄的男人很容易疲惫, 一次20到40分钟. 和别人总是难以高潮, 人们可能是喜爱连接的动物. 最有感觉的是刚进入的时候干燥的钝痛, 后来一切润滑后就变成润油的机器, 循环往复, 乏味得像每天的人生. 往后就连性也是乏味的. 只是孤独. 这个世上尽是麻木又孤独的人们.
She suddenly woke up. It was almost ten o’clock, and she needed to pack her things quickly to return to school. She took the crumpled 500 yuan from the table—enough to cover over a month’s meals. College students should earn more; next time, she’ll ask for a bit more, she thought to herself as she walked back.
The next day, her phone showed another man. Once you start down this path, whether it’s connections or money, it spreads like tree roots, slowly creeping into every corner of your mind. She sat in the car, thinking as it drove. She had never experienced certain thrills before; it would be interesting, she thought, though outsiders might judge harshly. A sense of raw honesty and openness came with it. Older men often sought out youthful energy, and she could feel her own vitality being drained in turn. Every encounter left her with a strange sense of shared life, a merging of old and new experiences. She found a curious satisfaction in giving a part of herself, watching the other person drink it in—intensely, yet fleetingly. Afterwards, she looked at the traces of the experience with detached curiosity, like cheap wine spilled on a sheet, waiting for the moment when it would fade.
Lying in a modest inn, she watched him sleep—his body marked by age, his hair streaked with gray. The room was warm and humid, filled with the presence of human connection. At this age, people grew tired easily; moments of intimacy were brief and often unfulfilling. The most striking feeling came at the beginning—sharp, unfamiliar, soon dulling into mechanical repetition. Day after day, life itself felt repetitive. Even intimacy had become monotonous. What remained was only solitude. The world was full of numb, lonely people.

title: 雷
content:
雷声响彻天空
轰隆隆的预警
风暴在这酝酿
这片荒野
结局警示各种危险
木轮细微偏差
行进几十年
吱呀地预言–
焦黑的尸体
自由者的白骨
刨土饱腹的骷髅
雨点变奏
夏的乐章
自然在这暴怒
我行驶着快散架的车
木轮尖叫着祈求挣脱。
看着零散的尸骨
我也会是其中之一。
七号，七碗
闪电迸亮了云层
大地震颤
雷电会劈下
焚毁我的全部神经

title: 照片
content:
他拿刻刀刮花我的照片
脸和身体模糊成一簇黑线
他暴躁得近乎哀伤
他要的是白纸, 不是照片
白屑吱吱咯咯
照片疙疙瘩瘩
有的破洞，
有的薄得透明
手指肿痛,
他看见了照片背后的空白
泪水模糊了他的世界–
他的血,
大半个人生的力气
还怎么回来呢?

title: 23s birthday
content:
You reach your birthday,
taking another step into 23
24 is the age when
someone took their own life.
How mothers break
when they lose their children—
even if those children
were flawed.
How girls fell asleep
while their rapist climbed the stairs.
How endless the laugh
when the death was revealed.
How students’ white T-shirts
turned into scarlet gowns.
How snow turns black
the moment it touches the ground.
How people filled the trucks,
pressed each other in a grip
to survive.
How children, alive
Someplace better
returned in dreams
with sugar still on their teeth.
In this deep well,
Your mother was also there—
spending New Year’s,
spending her birthdays
all alone.
Blowing out the candles
with a joy as inflated
as a balloon.

title: 鱼雷
content:
你在生命之海
沉浮
高举手臂
支吾得在像音乐节
静音的狂欢
你想说什么呢？
一把刀卡里面
你在颤抖
由内而外
缓慢的割喉
他们派我来拯救你
挪步让渡
多么大方–
五月花号的拥抱
燕尾服，高帽拐杖
像是质量检验
我是石油
这是亿年沉积的
第一桶
每个孩子
都是家庭的弥赛亚
你的爱
把我抓进深水
像生产那样竭力
仪器的心跳
跌断，
哔—哔作响
这次
我出生就死了
曾挤歪你内脏的卵
也都被潮汐带走了
母亲，
用你胃和肠的牺牲
狂蹬吧
鲨鱼森白的坟墓
如鱼雷般
瞄准了我们每一个人。

title: 鱼雷(torpedo)
content:
You drift
on the sea of life,
arms raised high,
stammering like
a muted festival of music.
What do you want to say?
A knife lodged inside—
you tremble,
from within outward,
slowly cutting your throat.
They sent me to save you,
stepping aside to yield
how generous —
The embrace of the Mayflower
tailcoat, top hat, cane,
like a quality inspection.
I am oil,
the first barrel
of a billion years’ sediment.
Every child
is the Messiah of the family.
Your love
drags me into deep water,
straining like labor,
the heartbeat of instruments
snapping,
beep—beep echoes.
This time
I die at birth
The eggs that once twisted
your entrails
have all been swept away by the tide.
Mother,
with the sacrifice of your stomach and intestines,
kick wildly.
A shark’s pale grave,
like a torpedo,
targets each of us.

title: 在巴比伦的河边
content:
我的城市被勇士清空
找到了
圣殿里藏起的画和文字。
骄傲的黄金勋章
在这瓦砾的世界跳动
在皮包骨头的孩子眼里
灵动如同精灵
端着喷香的食物
在巴比伦的河边
我找到了画：
我手拿左轮的
老去裸体。
勇士们认出我，大笑
问我对衣服底下的东西
是否诚实。
面包会给有价值的人
所以抓住青春,
换取多多的面包吧。
勋章闪耀如河水
锡安的日子也曾
填满我的河床
我把绳子挂在柳树上 —
以流亡为生的人
又怎么会害怕逃离呢？

title: 在巴比伦的河边(by the rivers of babylon)
content:
My city was emptied by warriors,
and they also found
the paintings and words
hidden in the temple.
Their proud golden medals
beat in this rubble-filled world,
in the eyes of skin-and-bone children,
alive as sprites,
carrying fragrant food.
By the rivers of Babylon
I found the painting—
me, holding a revolver,
aging, nude.
The warriors recognized me and laughed,
asking if I was honest
about what lay beneath my clothes.
Bread would be given to those of worth,
so seize your youth, and
trade it for much bread.
The medals gleamed like the river
Zion’s days once
filled my riverbed.
I hung the rope on a willow—
those who live by exile
how could they fear to flee?

content:
人们描绘着一个个纯真的少女
在花园里采摘迎春花
采到花从满溢的裙兜上滚下
掀起裙子的乐趣比不过
看着白裙晕成红色
我从不知道
有人和妈妈一样

我渴求任何营养
你来到我身边
我爬向你

尽管有时候她会变得残忍
爱是

爱是

爱是
无论咬痕多深，我们下次依旧能拥抱、融化成一体
爱是
当世界往你身上套上束身衣，我们却能在房间赤裸相待
然后你成功了
24岁
比两百粒药那次成功得多
我不知道你埋在了哪
我不知道你怎么死的
我问了4次
她不愿意告诉我
有天我半夜遛狗
有个中年男人停下问我个人信息
问我去不去酒吧
我怀念从前
那时候重要的事情都在世上
但理智告诉我代价太大了
所以我停了下来
再没有冒险
再没有半夜放肆歌唱
再没有烟酒
再没有呕吐
再没有尖叫
没有拥抱
没有性
没有妈妈
没有狗
没有家
生活要求我越来越多
什么都越来越空了
你走之后
我的红裙变成了铁锈色
它越来越黑
所以他们让我闪耀起来，
让我择偶的命令很搞笑。
我把我的过去和未来，
悬而未决的问题
连着我的烂衣服丢到一边
我的房间总是乱糟糟的，
每次排泄完回来，回床是个问题
我要绕开矿泉水瓶
初吻是什么感觉？
绕开妈妈的新鞋盒
对方怕你流血是什么感觉？
绕开餐巾纸
童年是什么样子我也记不清了。
绕开椅子
绕开拖鞋
绕开内裤
绕开衣服
我倒在床上
盯着漆黑的天花板
人去世时看到的大多是天花板。
那只没断奶的小狗也被压死了
当时它躲在车轮底下
它也曾见过母亲，于是急忙喝奶
但她躲着它，因为抢食而凶它
他们想再领一只小狗
但其他小狗前天就被卖去餐馆了
善良的人们为小狗埋藏哀悼
他们怪母狗生得太多
去年，今年，明年
母狗依旧会被一群两倍大的公狗尾随
生下一堆小狗
无论一岁，两岁，三岁
她矮小的体型都会让她交配卡住时被拖着走
只有凌晨允许她放声哀嚎
我从来没见过自由
我支付不起自由
8岁到23岁
时间像药片
从天花板撒下来
冬日暖阳下的雪花
落在我的脸上
还记得我6岁的照片
橘红色棉袄
一只手拿着雪球跳舞
所有人对我像孩子那样轻柔
我笑容甜蜜得像拥有了世界。
所以, 祝我生日快乐吧.
下个月我也24岁了

title: mama
content:
People depict innocent girls
picking primrose in the garden,
until the flowers tumble from skirts
Nothing compares to the joy of lifting their skirts
and watching their white skirts fade to scarlet.
I never knew
there were people like mama
who had milk inside them
After the thin, industrial milk powder,
I craved any nourishment.
You came to me,
and I crawled toward you,
like a puppy forced to be weaned.
Mama is good
Even though she’s sad sometimes.
Even though she can be cruel sometimes.
Love is
When I kneel down to drink milk, you’ll give me five yuan to buy a toy gun.
Love is
When I scream and kick, you remain calm, letting me be still.
Love is
When my white dress turns scarlet, you tell me it’s okay.
Love is
No matter how deep the bite marks, we still embrace—melting into one
Love is
When the world puts a straitjacket on you, we can still be naked in the room together.
And then you succeeded
At 24 years old
Much more successful than the time with the two hundred pills.
I don’t know where you’re buried
I don’t know how you died
I asked four times
She wouldn’t tell me
One night, around midnight, while walking my dog
a middle-aged man stopped me in the dark
he asked me for my personal information
asked if I wanted to go to a bar with him.
I missed the old days
when everything that mattered was still out there in the world.
But reason told me the price was too high.
So I stopped.
No more adventures
No more late-night singing
No more smoking and drinking
No more vomiting
No more screaming.
No hugs
No sex
No mama
No dog
No home.
Life demands more and more of me.
Everything feels increasingly empty now.
After you left,
my scarlet dress turned rusty brown.
It is getting darker now.
So they made me shine,
ordering me to choose a mate were hilarious.
I tossed aside my past and future,
the unresolved issues
along with my tattered clothes.
My room was always a mess.
Every time I came back from peeing,
getting into bed was a problem.
I had to avoid the water bottle.
What is a first kiss?
Avoid mama’s new shoebox.
What if your lover fears your blood?
Avoid the napkin.
I couldn’t remember my childhood.
Avoid the chair.
Avoid the slippers.
Avoid the underwear.
Avoid the clothes.
I collapsed on the bed,
staring at the dark ceiling.
When people die, they mostly see the ceiling.
The unweaned puppy was also crushed to death.
He had been hiding under the wheels.
He had seen his mother before and rushed to drink milk.
But she avoided him and was aggressive towards him for food.
They wanted to get another puppy,
but the others had been sold to a restaurant the day before.
Kind people mourned for the puppies.
They blamed the bitch for giving birth to too many.
last year, this year, next year
the bitch would still be followed by a pack of male dogs twice her size,
and still give birth to a ton of puppies.
whether she was one, two, or three years old.
Her small size meant she would be dragged away when mating got stuck.
Only the hour around 3 a.m. allowed her to wail.
I’ve never seen freedom
I can’t afford it.
From 8 to 23,
time is like pills,
falling from the ceiling.
Snowflakes under the warm winter sun fell on my face.
I still remember a photo of me when I was 6.
An orange cotton-padded jacket,
dancing with a snowball in one hand.
Everyone treated me as gently as a child.
My smile was so sweet, it felt like I owned the world.
So, Wish me a happy birthday.
I’ll be 24 next month.

title: I am not Prometheus
content:
She always shifts the fault to me.
She slips a blade into the seams of Egypt’s pyramids.
When she speaks from the heart, I must listen in kind.

title: 剩菜(leftovers)
content:
In the old days, when poverty
still allowed a slice of meat,
you pinned a price on every piece.
Dishes slick with a centimeter of grease,
day after day of slaughter,
life grinding you down.
Now food runs scarce,
no meat to be bought,
only the old method remains.
Your blade is still sharp,
hard enough to keep a family alive
for decades.
Life is all about trade-offs
You are a survivor.
In the heat of summer,
nameless irritations
cling to your face like flies.
On the table, gray meat.
Saliva tangled with soy sauce,
shreds of flesh tangled with fat.
Fullness gives you a flicker of ease.
Mixed with grains of rice and soup,
you toss away my bones.
The garbage exhales its sour rot.
Flies swarm in disorder,
mosquitoes spread across the walls,
the cicadas’ endless static.
And you leave behind
a flat, irritating burp.

孩子们要更多的手指，于是从别人的手指上抢下来，缝合在自己手上。或藏在自己的口袋里。多缝手指的孩子吃饭不便，容易沾染病菌死去，但至少他们死的时候是荣耀的。
强势的孩子有更多的手指，但手指永远轮不到弱势的孩子们。
一些手指少的孩子提出人人把手指平分，这个世界就好了。于是手指少的孩子们开始团结起来，从累积多手指的孩子那抢走了手指，平分。
平分多了些指头，一开始大家一致多给了带头的孩子。但随着时间推移，带头的孩子的手指不新鲜了，于是每当有新鲜的手指就给祂，不新鲜的手指就给其他人。
过了不久带头的孩子又召齐大会，觉得大家干活不积极。带头的孩子说：“干得多的手指更亮，干得少的手指会发霉”。
有人质疑说：这条规定只是有利于提出者自己的。
当众质疑的孩子第二天不知道到哪去了，积极替补的孩子得到了额外的手指。

孩子的食物比人口减少得快，带头的孩子抱怨众人干活不勤快。只有勤快才能得到更多的手指。孩子们加油干，但是食物该是不够果腹。祂们能闻见带头孩子帐篷传出的肉香味。没人知道带头孩子每天吃了什么。

难民区的大人来救孩子们，为祂们的瘦弱和手震惊。大人不敢看孩子们的手：飞满苍蝇的恶臭物质，像是倒挂的海葵。
